markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Gashadokuro](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1860)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The dreaded gashadokuro is an undead haunter of the night, spawning as a giant skeleton that rises from the earth in the aftermath of a mass starvation event. These enormous creatures then seek to inflict their unending hunger on the living.

 A gashadokuro that comes about due to a poor growing season is more prone to stalk remote village farmlands at night, while a gashadokuro that arose from the victims of a government-instigated food shortage has few compunctions about stomping straight into bustling cities in broad daylight. These latter gashadokuro even seem to target aristocrats and government authorities—whether or not they were the same politicians whose negligence resulted in the famine in the first place—leading many to believe that the gashadokuro seeks to slake its thirst for revenge even more than it seeks to sate its unending hunger.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 33

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Gashadokuro.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 13">[Gashadokuro](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1860)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Huge" />
<trait label="Undead" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=160" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 95, [Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City](/Sources.aspx?ID=13) pg. 84</row>

**Perception** +24; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1); (can't speak any language)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +27, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +24

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +8

**Dex** +4

**Con** +5

**Int** -3

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +3
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 33 

**Fort** +26 

**Ref** +21 

**Will** +24 

</row>

**HP** 230
([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42))

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38)

**Resistances**
[cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27) 10, [electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56) 10, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) 10, piercing 10, slashing 10

**Starvation Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) 60 feet. Any creature that ends its turn in the aura feels the intense pain of starvation and must attempt a DC 30 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature becomes [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15) and takes 6d6 damage. Damage and fatigue a creature takes from this aura can't be healed until the affected creature has eaten a full meal.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +27 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d12+14 piercing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +27 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d8+14 slashing

**Breath Weapon** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) The gashadokuro breathes a spray of bone shards in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area takes 8d12 piercing damage (DC 34 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds.

**Corpse Consumption**  ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) If the gashadokuro kills a creature with Swallow Whole, it immediately regains Hit Points equal to the swallowed creature's level. As long as the gashadokuro still exists, creatures consumed in this way can't be resurrected except by [_wish_](/Spells.aspx?ID=377) or a similarly powerful effect.

**[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) Large, 3d6+8 bludgeoning, Rupture 24

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Nocturnal Terrors</title>

The gashadokuro hunts for victims mainly after dusk, especially in the hour just after midnight. In parts of Tian Xia, particularly in the tumultuous regions of war and famine following the collapse of Imperial Lung Wa, parents hush their hungry children to sleep by warning that nighttime cravings will cause a gashadokuro to visit the household.
</aside>
name: Gashadokuro
